stories.text:
I just completed a rollup for one of my clients and one of the key components to their success will be a recruiter that can create a talent pipeline for them - without it, they will be up the creek.

Beyond the usual "ask for referrals/make a job post and share it around" does HN have any pro tips for finding a quality recruiter? Is there a place that recruiters - especially tech recruiters - congregate or otherwise share information?
stories.title: Ask HN: How do you recruit a recruiter?

stories.text:
https://www.chromestatus.com/feature/4590256452009984#details says web devs have a "positive" stance on it, but cite no sources, I call B.S.

I'm against it completely, it's invasive and unnecessary.

Would love to hear some thoughts.
stories.title: Ask HN: What is your opinion on the Idle Detection API introduced in Chrome 94?

stories.text:
I am trying to find a parable/short story that I've seen posted in HN comments (googling didn't yield any results). It is about a fictional world where, at some point, somebody invents "color" to paint their transparent houses and the government is passing policy to add surveillance. It shows how empty certain arguments from politicians are to pass laws to reduce privacy.

Can anybody help? (I will bookmark the story directly)
stories.title: Ask HN: What is the name of the parable about privacy?
